project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Camera No.10 PTZ Camera Replacement
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: CCTV Camera No.10 is a legacy analogue PTZ camera which has failed and there is suspected cable damage necessitating replacement of the camera and the associated connectivity cabling.
scope_of_work.scope: Replacement and re-cabling of the existing analogue PTZ camera (Camera # 10) with an IP professional grade CCTV PTZ camera to conform with the Kyndryl CCTV technical standard and configuration of the camera onto the Milestone CCTV platform
scope_of_work.justification: As all the CCTV cameras along the rear fence line are fixed cameras, No.10 has the ability to Pan, Tilt and  zoom to be able to follow and zoom in on situations that may arise. Replacing this camera avoids having blind spots along the perimeter fencing. A well maintained  CCTV system is essential to ensure that it is always operational and providing the best possible coverage identifying and addressing issues before they become major problems, and minimize the risk to the Kyndryl business
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Non replacement of camera No.10  will  leave the site  with blind spots along the rear fence and gate area.

project_name: UPM-HZ - Ph1A AHU Fan Failure / Refurb
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: 5th March call out to attend fire alarm activation, Suite CSC. On investigation located problem to be Ph1A roof plantroom smell of burning. Found Ph1A AHU intake fan to be catching on cowl. Specialist investigation found bearings collapsing and confirmed requirement for overhaul
scope_of_work.scope:
Dismantle, inspect and report.
Clean and stove winding, carry out necessary electrical tests.
Check bearing housings/seats and shafts for size and tolerance.
Check fan/impellor for defects.
Report and quote our findings.
Proceed with repairs inclusive of;
Supply and fit free issue bearings
Carry out fan balance
Reassemble fan unit
Repaint as required.
Reinstall fan unit
Run test with CBRE
scope_of_work.justification: Intake fan delivers fresh air to support DC air quality, temperature, humidity & required air changes as BP
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: System remains at N. Increased business risk not being able to maintain desired air quality to suites

project_name: UPM-Generator2 - engine heaters and oil/filter replacement
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled (2):offer submitted by Neil Hauck

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Generator2's engine heaters have failed. Additionally, the last oil sampling condition reports have indicated Generator2's engine oil and oil filters require replacement.
scope_of_work.scope:
1. Replace Generator2's engine heaters.
2. Replace Generator2's engine oil.
3. Generator2's engine oil filters.
scope_of_work.justification:
Old oil will not correctly lubricate and protect the internal engine components.
Engine heaters are an essential component for diesel engines operating in cooler temperatures. They maintain an 
engine's operating temperature during downtime and avoid any unnecessary idling. Warm coolant helps provide warmer cylinder temperatures, assisting the combustion process in extremely cold temperatures. Pre-heating also allows the engine to deliver full power immediately, an important factor for critical power applications.

project_name: UPM-Hz - YUPS DX2 Circuit 1 Refrigerant Leak
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):rejected by Jayme Feil (2):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (3):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: On routine DX inspections, YUPS Room DX2 Circuit 1 was found to have refrigerant oil leakage within the unit
scope_of_work.scope:
Isolate unit
Recover the refrigerant charge (record volume)
Repair known leaks
Pressure test unit with nitrogen
Evacuate to 4mbar
Re-establish the power supply
Recharge the unit to correct charge
Test run the system
scope_of_work.justification: The YUPS Room DX systems maintain the desired temperature for the critical Piller Rotary YUPS which serves DC suites CSB & CSC. It is also an FGas regulation to locate and repair any DX refrigerant leaks asap
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Reduced resilience and in breach of FGas regulations

associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (No), EANS/CMMS Update (No), O&M Manuals (No), Job Punch List (No), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (No), Single Source Approval (No), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)
